doc.title: growthpred

description.text: Sequence-based Prediction of Minimum Generation Times for Bacteria and Archaea

reference.a: The program sources and Example files are downloadable here.

doc.reference: Vieira-Silva S, Rocha EPC, 2010 The Systemic Imprint of Growth and Its Uses in Ecological (Meta)Genomics. PLoS Genet 6(1): e1000808. doi:10.1371/journal.pgen.1000808

comment.text: This application predicts the minimum generation time for a bacterial or archaeal organism based on its codon usage bias intensity (CUB). The CUB index is calculated given two input sets of sequences: 1) highly expressed genes 2) other genes. The application runs 1000 bootstraps and outputs the average and the standard deviation of the predictions.

interface.label:
Run with example data (-e)?
Yes No
Use a set of example files (E. coli K12) to run the program.
The expected results depending on the choosen option and the example files are shown in the program help pages (end of the form).

fieldset.title: This parameter is mandatory under certain conditions.
fieldset.legend: Enter sequences of highly expressed genes (-f)?

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: Set of genes under purifying selection for codon usage.

xhtml:div.label: Retrieve ribosomal protein genes by blast (-b) Yes No

fieldset.title: This parameter is mandatory under certain conditions.
fieldset.legend: Enter sequences of non-highly expressed genes/Complete genome (-g)?

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: Set of control genes with near random codon usage.

xhtml:div.label:
Mixed organisms sequences?
Yes No
You need to precise to the program if your sequences are metagenome or mixed organisms sequences.

Choose genetic code (-c) Universal Yeast Mitochondrial Vertebrate Mitochondrial Mold/Protozoan/Mycoplasma/Spiroplasma Invertebrate Mitochondrial Candida cylindracea Ciliate Euplotes Echinoderm/Flatworm Mitochondrial
Recover file with ribosomal protein genes retrieved by blast or given as input (-r) Yes No
Recover file with codon usage bias indexes for each gene (-i) Yes No
Estimate optimal growth temperature (-t) Yes No
Enter optimal growth temperature (Celsius) (-T)
Outfile name (-o)
